alert.note: Alert for Polk (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 06 at 3:50AM CST until March 06 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...QUICK BURST OF HEAVY SNOW FOR EASTERN MINNESOTA AND PORTIONS OF WESTERN WISCONSIN THROUGH 6AM... .A Winter Storm Warning remains in effect through 6 AM from Carver and Wright counties in Minnesota, northeast to Polk county in Wisconsin and Kanabec county in Minnesota. This includes Carver, Hennepin, and Anoka counties in the Twin Cities metro area. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect from Scott and Dakota counties in Minnesota to Barron county in Wisconsin through 6am as well. A band of very heavy snow, with snowfall rates at times exceeding 2 inches per hour is moving into the eastern Twin Cities metro area early this morning. This band of snow is expected to put down a quick 3 to 5 inches of snow within the warning area. In the advisory to the east, this snow band is expected to weaken, with snow amounts in the advisory expected to be in the 1 to 3 inch range. This heavy snow is falling on top of a slush from last night that is freezing up. This will result in treacherous travel conditions the rest of the night front the Twin Cities to the northeast and east through rest of tonight. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches on top of the glaze of ice received earlier in the night. * WHERE...Wright County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
